location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to George Brown, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that the Madras Horse Artillery are returning to India on board the cruizer Trenat[ Ternate] .It explains that the Bombay store lascars and artificers are returning on board the Ketch Fath Alleyinstead.The letter also notes that the Country Ship Moholaris likely to be carrying a large number of horses for the Madras market, and that the Gulf is not as free from piracy as it was.
